title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, from Lynn, charged with kidnapping and murdering his 38-year-old sister, Michelle Knox.
Smith pleaded not guilty to the charges in Lynn District Court; case details impounded by the judge.
Smith has a criminal history, previously pleading guilty to assault with a dangerous weapon in July.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks in a 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Landry and Milton Williams led with seven pressures each in New England's pass-rushing efforts.
Raiders QB Geno Smith achieved 362 passing yards, highlighting New England's secondary challenges.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews criticized the Patriots' ineffective run game in their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots managed only 60 rushing yards on 18 attempts, with no carries for Stevenson and Henderson in the second half.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel emphasized the need to run the ball more efficiently moving forward.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm will lead his first Bruins training camp on September 17 focusing on intensity and accountability.
The Bruins are aiming to improve this season after a 33-39-10 record, with emphasis on defense and power play.
Sturm's direct communication style is expected to help players rebound after last year's struggles.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Hubert faces charges of attempted murder, strangulation, child kidnapping, and aggravated rape in Worcester, Massachusetts.
The alleged victim, abducted at age 7, survived being thrown off a bridge and swam to safety in 2017.
The trial has faced delays since 2020, with Hubert pleading not guilty and seeking acquittal on all charges.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye discussed his performance and workload in a WEEI interview after the Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Mike Vrabel questioned if the Patriots' offensive system was too complex for Maye, but Maye disagreed with reducing his responsibilities.
Bill Belichick confirmed he banned Patriots scouts from UNC's practices, citing strained relations, but Maye continues to support his alma mater.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell faced challenges in his debut, contributing to two sacks and two penalties.
Veteran tackle Morgan Moses noted Game 1's difficulty due to unexpected defensive strategies.
Patriots struggled offensively, scoring only 13 points, following last season's third to last ranking in scoring.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kayshon Boutte was once a top-3 wide receiver prospect and compared to Stefon Diggs, but injuries affected his draft stock.
Boutte, a sixth-round Patriots pick, surprised with 103 yards in the season opener, proving past evaluations of his talent.
Despite slipping in the draft, Boutte's work ethic and performance in practice earned him trust and a key receiver role.

title: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hasbro is moving its headquarters from Pawtucket, Rhode Island, to Boston's Seaport at 400 Summer St.
The new Boston headquarters will occupy seven floors and house approximately 700 full-time employees by 2026.
Governor Maura Healey and Mayor Michelle Wu welcomed Hasbro's move, emphasizing job creation and partnership opportunities.

title: Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu leads Josh Kraft by 50 points in the upcoming Boston preliminary election, according to Emerson College poll.
Wu increased her lead from 30 points in mid-July and 13 points in February over rival Josh Kraft.
The preliminary election's outcome will narrow the candidate field for the general election on November 4.
